main event: A P56D pilot observed a spherical white object approximately 10 feet in diameter over Niagara AFB, New York on May 15, 1955.
interesting points: The object was seen on three consecutive occasions over a short observation period of 2-3 seconds., The object was described as spherical and white in color., The pilot circled the area multiple times in an attempt to observe the object further with negative results., The sighting raised various possibilities for identification including balloon, meteor, satellite, aircraft, and astronomical phenomena., The report concluded that due to the brevity of the sighting, identification authorities could not make a conclusive evaluation.
witness description: P56D pilot who observed the object during flight.
